topic.title: plugins/Trayicon for osx
topic.body:
This is the `plugin-trayicon` for osx. It is pretty dumb and it only serves as an
visual indication that ZeroNet is running. You can also quit zeronet daemon from the menu.

![screen shot 2016-03-07 at 2 22 03 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/91731/13577649/460dd2aa-e472-11e5-89d1-addcf8bce960.png)

I didn't added the statistics like the win32 version because the tray app should be a different process (in OSX), and i would have to implement some IPC. So i've stopped before doing this overly complex.

1604065107_mirrored_MyTheValentinus_gith.body:
You can do this with git hooks without any plugin:
1. Create a git remote pointing to your zeronet site folder . Don't forget to clean it first.

``` bash
    # Cleaning
    rm -rf ~/zeronet/data/1P9jGD6MBCieqFCHU1777CgyzoZZcnoba2 ;
    git init ~/zeronet/data/1P9jGD6MBCieqFCHU1777CgyzoZZcnoba2 ; 

    cd ~/mySite ;
    git remote add zeronet ~/zeronet/data/1P9jGD6MBCieqFCHU1777CgyzoZZcnoba2 ;
```
1. Create a `post-receive` hook files , and point to your **zeronet site address**

**~/zeronet/data/1P9jGD6MBCieqFCHU1777CgyzoZZcnoba2/.git/hooks/post-receive**

``` bash
ADDRESS=1P98WASDA1829381293

# Get all files
cd ..
GIT_DIR='.git'
umask 002 && git reset --hard

# SiteSign and Publish
echo 'ZeroNet: siteSign and sitePublish'
zeronet siteSign $ADDRESS  --publish
```
1. Ready! Now test using `git push zeronet master`
